metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26607 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: In the Linux kernel 6.0.8, there is an out-of-bounds read in ntfs_attr_find in fs/ntfs/attrib.c. It was discovered that the NTFS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate attributes in certain situations, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in github gist cascardo> this requires a corrupt filesystem rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, please refer to USN-6007-1.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
